info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 1:53AM EDT until May 14 at 4:15AM EDT by NWS Baltimore MD/Washington DC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...Portions of central and northwest Virginia, including the following counties, in central Virginia, Greene. In northwest Virginia, Madison.
* WHEN...Until 415 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 153 AM EDT, stream gauges indicated water levels remained elevated or in some cases were rising on medium stem rivers. This is due to rain that fell yesterday evening. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Madison... Stanardsville... Ruckersville... Brightwood... Pratts... Shelby... Aroda... Wolftown... Rochelle... Aylor... Banco... Haywood... Criglersville... Hood... Dawsonville... Graves Mill... Burtonville... Twymans Mill... Oakpark... Syria... - This includes the following Flood Prone Roads... Carpenters Mill Road at Route 607, Advance Mills Road and and Route 617, Westview Road and Deep Step Drive, Seminole Trail at White Run near Route 645, Route 621 along South River near Madison Road, Carpenters Mill Road and State Route 607, Dyke Road near Blue Run near Spotswood Trail, South River Road near The South River, Dundee Road at The South River, Octonia Road at South River Road, Celt Road near Amicus Road and F T Valley Road at Hughes River. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING
